game

Class Game

  • java.lang.Object
    • game.Game

  • public class Game
extends java.lang.Object
    General game manager class which stores all the states and attributes about the game session and directs all functions of the game.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      App app
      The App object to be stored within game.
      int commandKey
      Key which stores the most recent keyboard key to be compared with the debug mode's key.
      java.util.ArrayList<Consumable> consumableList
      A list storing all the consumable objects in the game.
      boolean debugMode
      Boolean for whether the debug mode is currently active.
      processing.core.PFont font
      The PFont object for the text font of the end screens.
      int frightenedLength
      The number of seconds that frightened mode lasts for.
      java.util.ArrayList<Ghost> ghostList
      A list storing all the individual ghost objects in the game.
      static int GHOSTOFFSET
      The offset value for ghost drawing positions.
      static int GRIDSPACE
      The size of each cell within the gridspace.
      int invisibleLength
      The number of seconds that invisible mode lasts for.
      int lives
      The number of lives Waka has.
      java.lang.String mapfile
      The name of the map file.
      java.lang.String mode
      String of the ghost mode currently in progress.
      int modeIndex
      An index pointing to the current number to be used within modeLengths.
      int[] modeLengths
      A list of numbers specifying the number of seconds each scatter and chase mode lasts.
      int moveKey
      Key which stores the direction of the most recent keyboard move command.
      java.lang.String previousMode
      String saving the previous standard ghost mode to revert back to from a special ghost mode.
      int speed
      The speed that Waka and the ghosts move at.
      int state
      Stores the state of the game as an integer.
      int timerEnd
      A timer to count the number of seconds after the game ends until it is reset.
      int timerMode
      A timer used to count the number of seconds of each ghost mode.
      int timerModeDifference
      A timer saving the difference in time until the next ghost mode to help pause the current mode during a special mode.
      int timerSpecial
      A timer used to count the number of seconds for each special mode.
      int timerWaka
      A timer used to animate Waka's mouth.
      Waka waka
      The Waka object.
      static int WAKAOFFSET
      The offset value for Waka's drawing position.
      java.util.ArrayList<Wall> wallList
      A list storing all the wall objects in the game.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Game(App app, java.lang.String filename)
      Constructor that parses and initialises all game data.
      Game(java.lang.String overloaded)
      An overloaded constructor for testing purposes so game attributes can be individually instantiated.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void checkEnd(App app)
      Check if the game has ended by fruit collection, loss of lives or all ghosts dead.
      void displayEnd(App app)
      Display the ending screen including text.
      void draw(App app)
      Draw all the elements of the game to the screen.
      void drawLives(App app)
      Draw the number of lives remaining as right-facing Waka sprites at the bottom of the screen.
      void manageTimers(App app)
      Manage all timers within the game for modes and animations.
      void resetSpawn()
      Reset Waka position, all ghost positions and the current mode to what they were at the start of the game.
      void specialMode(App app, java.lang.String specialMode)
      Change the current ghost mode to the specified special mode.
      void tick(App app)
      Conduct all game functionalities and update all game attributes.

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

        The offset value for Waka's drawing position.

        The offset value for ghost drawing positions.
        See Also:

      • app

        public App app
        The App object to be stored within game.

      • mapfile

        public java.lang.String mapfile
        The name of the map file.

      • lives

        public int lives
        The number of lives Waka has.

      • speed

        public int speed
        The speed that Waka and the ghosts move at.

      • frightenedLength

        public int frightenedLength
        The number of seconds that frightened mode lasts for.

      • invisibleLength

        public int invisibleLength
        The number of seconds that invisible mode lasts for.

      • modeLengths

        public int[] modeLengths
        A list of numbers specifying the number of seconds each scatter and chase mode lasts. (starts at scatter)

      • modeIndex

        public int modeIndex
        An index pointing to the current number to be used within modeLengths.

      • font

        public processing.core.PFont font
        The PFont object for the text font of the end screens.

      • waka

        public Waka waka
        The Waka object.

      • ghostList

        public java.util.ArrayList<Ghost> ghostList
        A list storing all the individual ghost objects in the game.

      • consumableList

        public java.util.ArrayList<Consumable> consumableList
        A list storing all the consumable objects in the game.

      • wallList

        public java.util.ArrayList<Wall> wallList
        A list storing all the wall objects in the game.

      • timerWaka

        public int timerWaka
        A timer used to animate Waka's mouth.

      • timerMode

        public int timerMode
        A timer used to count the number of seconds of each ghost mode.

      • timerModeDifference

        public int timerModeDifference
        A timer saving the difference in time until the next ghost mode to help pause the current mode during a special mode.

      • timerSpecial

        public int timerSpecial
        A timer used to count the number of seconds for each special mode.

      • timerEnd

        public int timerEnd
        A timer to count the number of seconds after the game ends until it is reset.

      • state

        public int state
        Stores the state of the game as an integer.
        (0 = in-progress, 1 = victory, 2 = defeat)

      • moveKey

        public int moveKey
        Key which stores the direction of the most recent keyboard move command.
        (left = 37, up = 38, right = 39, down = 40)

      • commandKey

        public int commandKey
        Key which stores the most recent keyboard key to be compared with the debug mode's key.
        (space-bar = 32)

      • debugMode

        public boolean debugMode
        Boolean for whether the debug mode is currently active.

      • mode

        public java.lang.String mode
        String of the ghost mode currently in progress.
        (scatter, chaser, frightened, invisible)

      • previousMode

        public java.lang.String previousMode
        String saving the previous standard ghost mode to revert back to from a special ghost mode.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Game

        public Game(App app,
            java.lang.String filename)
        Constructor that parses and initialises all game data.
        Parameters:
        app - The App object
        filename - The name of the configuration file

      • Game

        public Game(java.lang.String overloaded)
        An overloaded constructor for testing purposes so game attributes can be individually instantiated.
        Parameters:
        overloaded - Any string (to simply signify that the overloaded constructor is to be used)

    • Method Detail

      • tick

        public void tick(App app)
        Conduct all game functionalities and update all game attributes.
        Parameters:
        app - The App object

      • draw

        public void draw(App app)
        Draw all the elements of the game to the screen.
        Parameters:
        app - The App object

      • checkEnd

        public void checkEnd(App app)
        Check if the game has ended by fruit collection, loss of lives or all ghosts dead.
        If so start the timer counting the number of seconds until the game is to be reset.
        Parameters:
        app - The app object

      • displayEnd

        public void displayEnd(App app)
        Display the ending screen including text.
        Parameters:
        app - The App object

      • manageTimers

        public void manageTimers(App app)
        Manage all timers within the game for modes and animations.
        Parameters:
        app - The App object

      • drawLives

        public void drawLives(App app)
        Draw the number of lives remaining as right-facing Waka sprites at the bottom of the screen.
        Parameters:
        app - The App object

      • specialMode

        public void specialMode(App app,
                        java.lang.String specialMode)
        Change the current ghost mode to the specified special mode.
        Parameters:
        app - The App object
        specialMode - A string specifying the name of the special mode to be changed to (frightened, invisible)

      • resetSpawn

        public void resetSpawn()
        Reset Waka position, all ghost positions and the current mode to what they were at the start of the game.
